intro: Gustavia ulei, commonly known as the pink hibiscus mealybug plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. However, it is also known to host the pink hibiscus mealybug, which can be a pest in agricultural settings.
